Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2010 09:28PM resaz wrote: Thank you Tara! I am supposed to meet with a breast surgeon next wednesday.  After the radiologist who did another test on the discharge said that it did contain blood, my doctor called and said that I needed to see a surgeon.  He said it didn't mean that I would have to have surgery but that that's where I needed to go.  I guess from what I understand about even a papilloma, they will take it out.  If that's indeed the case then why even do a ductogram??  Seems a bit over the top if it's just going to be taken out anyway for them to examine. Unless there is some unknown to me condition that causes bleeding that will not need to be removed but I haven't found anything that causes bleeding in the duct that is not removed. I'm trying to focus on it all being fine b/c I know that there is really nothing I can do anyway until I have the answers.  I just want to be as educated about it all as possible so I know what to ask.... Thanks again for taking the time to reply, I really appreciate it!!  Res
